info.title: EcoStruxure Building API
info.description:
# Overview

EcoStruxure™ Building Management API provides access to Schneider Electric's building solutions for customers and ISVs to connect, monitor, and control devices deployed in the building.

## API overview and usage

This API enables the following operations:

**Monitoring**
- Check occupancy of a space or workspace
- Check attendance of a space
- Generate occupancy report

**Control**
- Check and control A/C
- Check and control blinds & shutters
- Check and control lightings
- Check comfort level, CO2, humidity, and temperature

## How it works

To be completed.

# Documentation
    
## How to sign up for the API
    
Before you can sign up for the `EcoStruxure™ Building Management` API, you must [register or login with an Exchange account](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://exchange.se.com).*5CnThen__;JQ!!GF_29dbcQIUBPA!zuqtb4Who4etr82CjOl_qyYda8b3c2btHbacAZAmgZJcCfQmJKAm0V7gBUhfymKBWlm5kaJjQ9h_u0XuypWSjekEIDk2kSs$ [exchange[.]se[.]com)[.]%5cnthen] you can subscribe to the [API product in our Shop](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://exchange.se.com__;!!GF_29dbcQIUBPA!zuqtb4Who4etr82CjOl_qyYda8b3c2btHbacAZAmgZJcCfQmJKAm0V7gBUhfymKBWlm5kaJjQ9h_u0XuypWSjekE5-Tx7mg$ [exchange[.]se[.]com]) and you can read about Terms & Conditions. After subscription, you will receive further information on how to access the API including the API credentials.

Status of your API consumption will soon be available from the [Exchange cockpit](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://exchange.se.com)*5Cn*5Cn**A__;JSUjIw!!GF_29dbcQIUBPA!zuqtb4Who4etr82CjOl_qyYda8b3c2btHbacAZAmgZJcCfQmJKAm0V7gBUhfymKBWlm5kaJjQ9h_u0XuypWSjekEpUJHAmg$ [exchange[.]se[.]com)%5cn%5cn] Authentication guide

This API supports the following authentication mechanism. If you are an ISV requiring access to Schneider Electric customer data then use [Oauth2 Authorization Code Grant](#Oauth2AuthCode) authorization schema, if you are a Schneider Electric customer using the API to access your own data then use [Personal Access Token](#PersonalAccessToken) authorization.

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

## Code Samples

You can leverage the code samples provided to integrate the API faster in your application.

Use any of the helper libraries available below to understand better on the functionality of the API. 

* ### [Postman Collection](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://github.com/ecostruxure-openapi/building-management-api)*5Cn*5Cn*5Cn**A__;JSUlIyM!!GF_29dbcQIUBPA!zuqtb4Who4etr82CjOl_qyYda8b3c2btHbacAZAmgZJcCfQmJKAm0V7gBUhfymKBWlm5kaJjQ9h_u0XuypWSjekE_misYuc$ [github[.]com] Support

Contact the Exchange support team at exchange.support@se.com.

In your request please :

    - mention the involved endpoint
    - give the request that generate the error
    - copy past any error message you received
    - add some screen shot
---

tags.name: Occupancy
tags.description: Everything about occupancy details for a site.

get.description: Get a space occupancy status using site and space reference.
Get all workspace occupancy status using site and space reference.
Get a workspace occupancy status using site, space and workspace reference.

post.description: Generate space occupancy analytics details for given site and filter criteria.

get.description: Get a space attendance detail using site and space reference.

post.description:
Control the AC the temperature offset. 

The temperature offset value is ranging from -3.0 to +3.0 with 0.5 step. Supported commands are :
* "AC_UP": increase T° setpoint 
* "AC_DW": decrease T° setpoint
* "SET": directly set the desired value

If `SET` is passed, a field `value` needs to be provided.

The command can be repeated several times by setting the "repeats" parameter.

get.description:
Get the AC temperature offset in the specified space.

It returns the temperature offset value ranging from -3.0 to +3.0. If not yet available, a 404 is returned with reason.

Offset-with-unit.summary: A sample with 1.5 degree celsius offset.

get.description:
Get the AC temperature offset directive in the specified space.

It returns the range of allowed offset in a JSON object with values "min" and "max" specified. If not yet available, a 404 is returned with reason.

post.description:
Control the AC fan speed. 

Supported commands are :
* "AC_S1": activate Speed 1,
* "AC_S2": activate Speed 2,
* "AC_S3": activate Speed 3

get.description:
Get the AC fan speed in the specified space. 

Possible values returned :
* "AUTO": Auto mode,
* "V1": Speed 1, 
* "V2": Speed 2, 
* "V3": Speed 3

post.description:
Control the AC mode. 

Supported commands are :
* "AC_ON": force AC activation ,
* "AC_OFF": stop,
* "AC_AUTO": switch to Auto mode

get.description: Get the AC zones numbers in the specified space.

Get the humidity percentage in the specified space.

It returns a value between 0-100.

Get the CO2 level in the specified space (in ppm).

It returns a numeric value greater than 0.

Get the current temperature in the specified space (displayed in degrees Celsius).

It returns a numeric value

post.description:
Control the blinds and shutters. 

Supported commands are: 
* "BS_UP": roll up 
* "BS_DW": roll down 
* "BS_STOP": stop 
* "BS_AUTO": switch to Auto mode
* "SET": set the blind's position to a value between 0-100

If `SET` is passed, a field `value` needs to be provided.

If `group` is set to 0, a space level command will be issued.

get.description: It returns the position of blinds and shutter in percentage

post.description:
Control the blinds angle. 

Supported commands are: 
- "SET"

The value between 0-100 needs to be provided in the field "value"
If `group` is set to 0, a space level command will be issued.

get.description: It returns the angle of blinds and shutter in percentage
Get blinds/shutters groups numbers in the specified space.

post.description:
Control the lighting. 

Supported commands are: 
* "L_ON": switch on lights 
* "L_OFF": switch off lights 
* "L_UP": launch dim up 
* "L_DW": launch dim down 
* "L_AUTO": switch to Auto mode 
* "L_STOP": stop dimming
* "SET": set the lights to a value between 0-100

If `SET` is passed, a field `value` needs to be provided.

If `zone` is set to 0, a space level command will be issued.

get.description: It returns the lighting intensity in percentage.
Get lighting zone numbers in the specified space.

It returns the lighting mode, following values are possible.
- MODE_AUTO
- MODE_MANUAL

post.description:
Set the different scenes to their AUTO mode. 

Supported commands are :
* "AUTO": Set to auto mode.

Only auto mode is supported.

scopes.read:occupancy: Read access to building occupancy data
scopes.read:control: Read access to building controls like lights, blinds & shutters and A/C
scopes.write:control: Write access to building controls like lights, blinds & shutters and A/C

PersonalAccessToken.description: Personal access token based authentication and authorization. You can generate personal access token for APIs through Schneider Electric Developer Portal.

reference.description: Reference value for space or workspace.

workingDays.description: Defines days from 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday) as working days

AnalyticsRequest-v1.description:
If not set, Default value for time segment :

```
"timeSegment": {
	"startHour": 8,
	"endHour": 18,
	"workingDays": [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
}
```

Working days start from 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).

Measurement-v1.description: Object representing measurement unit and value.
